org.mini2Dx.core.playerdata

Interface PlayerData

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndroidPlayerData, DesktopPlayerData, IOSPlayerData

    public interface PlayerData
    Common interface for reading/writing player data, e.g. game saves, preferences, etc. The location to save data in is automatically determined by the game identifier and the current platform. All files/directories specified by the developer will be automatically placed inside the pre-determined data location. Note: Objects must use Field annotations to be serialized/deserialized properly

    • Method Detail

      • readString

        java.lang.String readString(java.lang.String... filepath)
                            throws PlayerDataException
        Reads the contents of a file in the player data location into a String
        Parameters:
        filepath - The path to the file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.
        Returns:
        A string containing the contents of the file
        Throws:
        PlayerDataException - Thrown if the file does not exist

      • writeString

        void writeString(java.lang.String content,
               java.lang.String... filepath)
                 throws PlayerDataException
        Writes a String to a file in the player data location
        Parameters:
        content - The String to be written to the file
        filepath - The path to the file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.
        Throws:
        PlayerDataException - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed or the data cannot be written to the file.

      • readXml

        <T> T readXml(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
            java.lang.String... filepath)
          throws PlayerDataException
        Converts XML from a file into an object. Note the object must use the mini2Dx data annotations.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The object type to convert the XML into
        filepath - The path to the XML file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.
        Returns:
        The resulting object
        Throws:
        PlayerDataException - Thrown if the XML is invalid, the file does not exist or the game data location cannot be accessed.

      • writeXml

        <T> void writeXml(T object,
                java.lang.String... filepath)
              throws PlayerDataException
        Writes an object as XML to a file. Note the object must use the mini2Dx data annotations.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be written to the file
        filepath - The path to the XML file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.
        Throws:
        PlayerDataException - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed or the data cannot be written to the file.

        Parameters:
        clazz - The object type to convert the JSON into
        filepath - The path to the JSON file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.
        Returns:

        Throws:

        filepath - The path to the JSON file. This will be resolved as a path within the game data location.

        Checks if the file exists in the game data location
        Parameters:
        filepath - The path to the file within the game data location
        Returns:
        True if the file exists
        Throws:
        PlayerDataException - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed

      • hasDirectory

        boolean hasDirectory(java.lang.String... path)
                     throws PlayerDataException
        Checks if the directory exists in the game data location
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the directory within the game data location
        Returns:
        True if the file exists
        Throws:
        PlayerDataException - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed

      • createDirectory

        void createDirectory(java.lang.String... path)
                     throws PlayerDataException
        Creates a directory within in the game data location
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the directory within the game data location
        Throws:
        PlayerDataException - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed or the directory could not be created

      • delete

        boolean delete(java.lang.String... path)
               throws PlayerDataException
        Deletes a file or directory within in the game data location
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the file or directory within the game data location
        Returns:
        True if the file or directory was deleted successfully
        Throws:
        PlayerDataException - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed or the file/directory could not be deleted

      • wipe

        void wipe()
          throws PlayerDataException
        Wipes all data within the game data location
        Throws:
        PlayerDataException - Thrown if the game data location cannot be accessed or the data could not be wiped
